intro: Dichapetalum chalotii, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a shrub native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes. Its milky sap, which is toxic, gives it its common name. Dichapetalum chalotii is often found in savanna and woodland habitats.
